record.dc:title: 58RE12 DeArmond Site 2RE12, Roane Co., TN. Feature 21, Circular fire basin of puddled clay with vertical sides and flat bottom and slightly modeled rim. Basin associates with Feature 21 dwelling pattern. Datum 7.4' (Floor). Sq. 39L7. Direction east.
record.wpa:narrative: This structure was the "pit" type and consisted of a rectangular pattern delineated by fairly large pos molds with fairly wide interstices. The corners were slightly rounded and four interior molds seemed to associate as roof support molds. This house is of the same type as Feature 5 but lacks any entrance manifestations. The pit or depression is rectangular with rounded corners and the point of intrusion was found about 0.4' above the structure floor, which was primarily burned in appearance. The central fire basin was of prepared clay and had a slightly molded rim, but this was chiefly acccentuated by the fact that the basin was constructed over an earlier basin denoting an earlier occupancy of the area. Only a part of the side of the earlier basin was found, it being vertical. No bottom section was found. The arc described by the wall section indicated a basin about the size of the one associated with this house. Note: The ash content of the basin with this house had been raked out for a short depth inside the basin and was deposited around most of the rim. The ash was thus deposited when the baisn was uncovered. This is shown in the photograph of the house. The floor of this house was burned in the central section, particularly around the central fire basin and seemed to be a prepared clay floor over this area. However, generally speaking, the floor was accretive with a burned surface.
record.wpa:comments: 19 Field Specimen numbers on file at the institution and range from 1296, 1297, 1299 then from 2222 to 2311. See also photograph 56RE12 [fhm01557].
